name: Stefanie Graf
fact: In 1988, Graf becomes the first ever tennis player to achieve the Golden Grand Slam, winning all four major tennis singles as well as an Olympic gold medal in the same year. This accomplishment is one of many to cement her as one of the greatest tennis players of all time.

name: Nadia Comaneci
fact: In 1976, Nadia Comaneci becomes the first ever gymnast to score a perfect 10, an event  so unprecedented that the scoreboard couldn't even properly display her score. Through the course of her Olympic participation, she received six more perfect tens and three more gold medals.

name: Charlotte Cooper
fact: In 1900, a time where female tennis players had to wear long dresses while playing, Cooper became the first female champion in tennis, and therefore first female athlete to win gold in an Olympics event ever. She was a prominent tennis player in her time, having won 5 Wimbledon single titles during her career, and stands as the oldest winner of the title even to this day.  Her success demonstrated the possibilities that the Olympics held for female athletes, and how they could be a further demonstration of their dominance.

name: Alice Coachman
fact: In 1948, Alice Coachman becomes the first Black woman to win an Olympic gold medal, all while setting a new Olympic record and being the only American woman in the games that year to win a medal. A demonstration of the growing diversity in the Olympics, she paved the way for future Black American female track stars.

name: NA
fact: The Paris 2024 Olympics will be the first time in history where there will be equal amounts of female and male athletes partcipating, 5,250 to be exact.

name: Joan Samuelson
fact: In the Los Angeles 1984 games, Samuelson became the first ever female Olympic marathon champion. The first time that marathon events were held for women, her success dispelled the misconception that women's health prevented them from being able to complete marathons. Samuelson not only won gold, but did so only 17 days after a knee surgery.

name: Trebisonda Valla
fact: In 1936, Valla became the first Italian to woman to win gold at the Olympics, However her legacy is not simply maintained by this fact. She had previously debated partcipating in the 1932 Olympics, but had decided not to because of pushback from the Vatican, who had believed partcipation would be uncouth.  Regreting not going, she decided to attend the 1936 Olympics, in the process making history and providing a pathway for future female athletes.

name: Clara Hughes
fact: In 2006, Clara Hughes became the only ever athlete to win several medals in during the Winter and Summer Olympics. She currently holds 2 bronze medals in road cycling, 2 in speed skating, and 1 silver and 1 gold also in speed skating.
